definition: number off! (command in military drill)/count off!
to announce/to inform/report/newspaper/recompense/revenge/CL:份[fen4],張|张[zhang1]
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
number/figure/several/CL:個|个[ge4]
frequently/repeatedly

sentences.english: The teacher told the children to count off from right to left.
sentences.chinese: 教师叫孩子们自右向左报数。

sentences.english: What is more, it has the measurement voice output because of using new technique of speech process.
sentences.chinese: 引入语音处理新技术，实现测量结果语音报数。

sentences.english: None-Agricultural Population is from the Police Annals.
sentences.chinese: 非农业人口为公安年报数。

sentences.english: The soldiers numbered off from the right.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们从右首开始报数。

sentences.english: The company was numbered off by the sergeant major.
sentences.chinese: 军士长下令让连队报数。

sentences.english: The soldiers counted off from right to left.

definition: to count/to reckon
oral command/a word of command (used in drilling troops or gymnasts)/password (used by sentry)
to stand/Stand up!
erhua variant of 挨個|挨个[ai1 ge4]
to know how to count and do sums/numerate/numeracy
to beat a gong
to compete to be the first to answer a question (as on a quiz show)
to yell/to shout/to call out for (a person)
fill a form
to do exercises/to do gymnastics
to march at parade step/March! (military command)
to count out (a sum of money etc)
to read ballot slips out loud
to randomly select (as for a lottery)/to take a number (for queuing)
recorder
on day duty
